SpecificMotivation.Name: Discovery
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Discovery[h4] Seeking out and discovering new worlds, information, or the wondrous secrets hidden among the galaxy's countless stars drives this character's actions. More than anything, he wants to find and experience things nobody else has.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Enlightenment
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Enlightenment[h4] The character seeks spiritual and Intellectual enlightenment above all else. He does not seek to bring enlightenment to others, for he realizes that such a goal is innately personal.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Expertise
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Expertise[h4] The character wants to excel in his chosen profession and constantly practices to achieve perfection. Alternatively, this character picks a skill or two in which to excel.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Fame
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Fame[h4] The character seeks the limelight and wants to be famous. He wants his deeds and actions to make the HoloNet for all to see and revels in the attention given by fans and supporters.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Freedom
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Freedom[h4] The character desires the freedom to do what he wants. This could be a passion to overcome one or more of his current Obligations or to see others freed from the shackles of bondage and servitude in all its forms.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Friendship
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Friendship[h4] The character seeks to be liked by others and goes out of his way to make a good impression. He may or may not be gregarious, relying on his actions and deeds to foster friendship.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Glory
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Glory[h4] Fame and the spotlight beckon to this character. He wants to perform great deeds, and be celebrated for them.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Greed
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Greed[h4] Money is the prime motivator for this character. The character may be active in business, investing, or the tried-and-true method of theft to increase his credit bank.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Become a Jedi
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Become a Jedi[h4] The character wants nothing more than to become a Jedi Knight, though he may not be sure how to do so.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Love
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Love[h4] The character is driven by love or intimacy. The character already has a true love or strives to find the one he is meant to be with.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Power
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Power[h4] The character craves power and authority over others. His rule may not be despotic, but he wants to control his situation and those around him, often bettering himself in the process.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Religion/Spirituality
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Religion/Spirituality[h4] The character is both drawn and follows the sway of a particular religious or spiritual calling. This could be the tenets of the Jedi or the Sith or some other belief.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Revenge
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Revenge[h4] At some point in the character's past, he was brutally wronged. Now he seeks vengeance, and he has a hard time focusing on anything else.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Destroy the Sith
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Destroy the Sith[h4] Through ancient texts or diligent research, the character has learned of the Jedi's ancient enemies: the Sith. He has set out to defeat and destroy their order, or at the very least, do what he can to hinder them.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Status
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Status[h4] The character wants to elevate his social standing—gaining titles, commendations, and accolades. The character may come from humble beginnings or otherwise strive for a higher position than where he began.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Survival
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Survival[h4] In a galaxy where simply being a Force user can be a death sentence, the characters primary concern is survival. He's willing to do what it takes to make sure he lives another day.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Wanderlust/Novelty
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Wanderlust/Novelty[h4] The character is driven to explore the galaxy and rarely stays in one place for long. He's motivated to uncover remote or unexplored regions and see everything that can be seen. Alternatively, this character is driven to experience new sensations and activities, perhaps rather hedonistically.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Wealth
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Wealth[h4] Money motivates this character. Often, his choices are based less on the consequences of right and wrong, and are based more on what will be best for his credit account.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Crime
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Crime[h4] The Player Character makes all or part of his living off of illegal dealings of some kind (such as smuggling) which has become increasingly difficult under the rule of the Empire. He believes that with a new order in place, new opportunities will arise for profit.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Force
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Force[h4]

SpecificMotivation.Name: Freedom
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Freedom[h4] The absolute and autocratic rule of the Emperor is an offense to this Player Character's core beliefs about governments and politics. He might, in fact, oppose central authoritarianism in all forms, yet see the Alliance as a "lesser evil' he can deal with after the Empire is brought down.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Free Enterprise
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Free Enterprise[h4]

SpecificMotivation.Name: Honor
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Honor[h4] The Player Character has a code of honor by which he lives, derived either from personal ethics or the culture from which he hails. He sees the Empire as the antithesis of everything he stands for, and he will fight it to the end.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Justice
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Justice[h4] The character has a strong, unshakable sense of right and wrong, and he sees the injustices of Imperial rule throughout the galaxy. He is committed to seeing justice brought back to the galaxy, and he wishes those who have betrayed it to receive the punishment they deserve.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Liberty
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Liberty[h4]

SpecificMotivation.Name: Order
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Order[h4]

SpecificMotivation.Name: Peace
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Peace[h4] The Player Character believes that as long as the Empire remains in power, the galaxy will forever know war, bloodshed, and violence. He hopes to bring peace to the galaxy by overthrowing the Empire as quickly as possible. In addition, if a peaceful resolution can be found for the war, he will embrace it.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Progress
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Progress[h4] The Empire's tight control of galactic commerce has made it hard for anyone outside the Imperial military to create or acquire new technology. The Player Character believes that the only way to bring a new era of progress to the galaxy is to remove the Emperor from power.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Religion/Philosophy
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Religion/Philosophy[h4] The PC is an adherent of a particular religious order or set of teachings, or is a follower of a set of philosophical principles. Whatever it is, this set of beliefs moves him to serve the Alliance.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Republic
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Republic[h4] The Player Character believes in the Republic and all it stood for. He is determined to restore it in all its glory (and hopefully to what it was before corruption set in).

SpecificMotivation.Name: Species Rights
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Species Rights[h4] The Empire's dismissal of and outright antagonism toward non-humans is atrocious in every way, and this Player Character wants to put an end to it. The Alliance is his best means to see that non-humans gain the voice and the respect they deserve.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Jedi
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Jedi[h4] The PC believes the Jedi were the greatest part of what was good in the galaxy and that their elimination destroyed the moral and ethical fabric of civilization. He is determined to help restore them to their rightful place. Alternatively, he simply believes in the philosophy and teachings of the Jedi and knows that fighting the Empire is what they would do.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Capitalism
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Capitalism[h4] The character is an unabashed capitalist and fights for the rights of merchants, trading organizations, and business, sometimes running counter to the wishes of both the Empire and some criminal groups.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Crime
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Crime[h4] The character supports the idea of black markets, mercenaries, and other groups that fall outside of the law. The character need not be a criminal himself. but may give aid to other criminals, especially if they are family members, childhood friends. or if corruption is deeply embedded in the character's originating culture.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Droid Rights
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Droid Rights[h4] The character believes that droids should be accepted as full members of galactic society, not merely tools or servants.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Emancipation
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Emancipation[h4] The character sees slavery and indentured servitude as an abomination that must be undone. He'll go out of his way to aid or attempt to free anyone kept in slavery.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Support the Empire
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Support the Empire[h4] The character actually supports the goals and methods of the Empire and does his best to advance its cause. He'll defend the Empire in conversation and may actively take up arms in its defense.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Equality
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Equality[h4] All sentient beings deserve the right to be treated with respect and as peers by other beings, regardless of their state of technological sophistication. When the character finds those who do not possess equality, he seeks to better their lot in life.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Freedom
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Freedom[h4] All sentient beings must have the opportunity to make their own decisions. For good or for ill, and the right to face the consequences or receive the just rewards For their actions. The character seeks freedom for the enslaved and oppressed, and fights against organizations that promote slavery or subjugate their people.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Free Enterprise
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Free Enterprise[h4] Free and unimpeded trade between cultures can create opportunity, innovation, and understanding. Governments cannot be permitted to impede such interactions and the character seeks to do what he can to support this.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Help the Helpless
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Help the Helpless[h4] In a galaxy full of momentous events and desperate struggle, it is all too easy to forget the poor, the weak, and the downtrodden. The character seeks to give voice to the voiceless, and help those who cannot help themselves.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Justice
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Justice[h4] In a galaxy full of wrongdoing, justice must be done. The character seeks to bring justice to those who deserve it, while helping victims of injustice to right the wrongs done to them.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Knowledge
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Knowledge[h4] All sentient beings deserve an education that gives them a broader view of the galaxy. This character promotes the discovery and dissemination of all knowledge, to improve the lives of everyone in the galaxy.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Non-Human Rights
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Non-Human Rights[h4] The character fights for the rights of non-humans in the very xenophobic rule of the Empire.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Overthrow the Empire
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Overthrow the Empire[h4] The character despises the Empire and everything that it stands for. He may or may not be an active member of the Rebellion, but he supports its goals and gives aid and comfort to those against Imperial tyranny.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Galactic Peace
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Galactic Peace[h4] The galaxy has been torn and shattered by decades of warfare. The character wants nothing more than to see peace restored to the galaxy, and recognizes that concerted efforts must be made to resolve galactic warfare.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Local Politics
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Local Politics[h4] The character supports some particular political cause, typically within a single planet or system. The character actively gets involved in campaigns and candidates. and may even fight on the behalf of a political organization.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Religion/Spirituality
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Religion/Spirituality[h4] The character actively supports some religious or spiritual organization or belief. This could include the tenets of the Jedi or Sith codes or some other belief.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Restore the Jedi
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Restore the Jedi[h4] The character wants to see the Jedi Order restored and rebuilt, although what he knows of the Jedi may be limited or even inaccurate. He may want to be a Jedi, or just want to see them return to being a presence in the galaxy.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Stop the Rebellion
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Stop the Rebellion[h4] The Rebel Alliance Is an organization of outlaws and malcontents who fight against their legitimate government. The character may not like the Empire, but he dislikes the Alliance more, and wants to see it stopped.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Weak/Charity
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Weak/Charity[h4] The character fights for the underdog, disliking bullies and totalitarianism. He'll put the interests of those in need before his own and may donate time or money to aid the less fortunate.
SpecificMotivation.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecificMotivation.Name: Liberation
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Liberation[h4] This character works against oppression of all kinds. Harsh masters, domineering societies, even overzealous companions can spark the need to rise up against oppression and liberate the helpless.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Superiority
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Superiority[h4] This character strives to prove their superiority by improving fighting skills, amassing credits or followers, or earning a reputation.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Birthright
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Birthright[h4] This character's discovery of the Force awakened a need to claim forgotten teachings, martial techniques, and a forbidden way of life. Legends drive this character both to learn about and strive to emulate the Jedi of old.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Perfection
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Perfection[h4] This character is determined to be the best, to uncover the best in others, and to seek out perfection in an imperfect universe. The impossibility of the goal is irrelevant, as all improvement is beneficial, and the intent matters. This character continually seeks betterment, resulting in brilliance or, more often, disappointment.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Meaning
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Meaning[h4] In a war-torn universe, any character might yearn for meaning in the chaos. This character may seek someone who can share wisdom, or may spend time studying and working with the Force, hoping for answers. The character might even seek meaning in Sith temples or other dangerous places.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Acceptance
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Acceptance[h4] This character seeks acceptance in a universe that persecutes Force sensitives, wishing for a satisfying role in a community, whether a colony or a crew.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Legacy
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Legacy[h4] In a vast and varied galaxy, it is not easy for one character to make a significant difference. This character is eager to leave a lasting mark, to pass techniques on to a pupil, or to simply inspire others.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Recognition
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Recognition[h4] Jedi once rose above the need for recognition, but for this character honing newfound abilities, it is a driving force. It is only natural to seek recognition of efforts and skills when they are so difficult to acquire and control.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Worthy Opponent
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Worthy Opponents[h4] The character requires a worthy foe and wants to fight against a nemesis worthy of the name. This character seeks to test themself on the field of battle against multiple opponents or a seasoned Force user. The challenge has to be worth the character’s attention, and they may seek a specific opponent, such as a Sith or the Emperor himself.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Martial Mastery
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Martial Mastery[h4] This character seeks to master one or many martial arts, and so craves a teacher or experience. The battle itself is more important than the win, and defeat is acceptable as long as it enables the character to learn.

SpecificMotivation.Name: No Collateral Damage
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]No Collateral Damage[h4] Though some particularly pernicious bounty hunters are willing to toss around thermal detonators on populated worlds, most try to minimize the civilian harm they cause, if only because it can be inconvenient to clean up. A few, however, are scrupulous about avoiding civilian casualties, to the point of letting a target escape to avoid hurting civilians.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Finish the Job
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Finish the Job[h4] It is a rare bounty hunter who keeps pursuing prey even when it becomes clear that the hunt is not economically viable. This bounty hunter is one of the rare exceptions; her word is irrevocable, and once she has taken a contract, the character pursues it at all costs. While a job might be put on hiatus, once the hunt begins, she can never abandon or forget it—perhaps even if the client rescinds the bounty.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Live Capture
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Live Capture[h4] Some bounty hunters vow to never kill their targets (though when dealing with a crime lord who requests a target be brought in alive, this can be a cruel mercy indeed). Whether the PC does not kill out of pride, pity, squeamishness, or desire for the maximum payout, this character steadfastly refuses to take the life of a target.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Never Again
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Never Again[h4] The character has suffered some disgrace or loss and vowed never to repeat it. Perhaps the character broke an oath to protect and serve the people, or was somehow framed for doing so after trusting the wrong person. Though the shame of failure cannot be erased fully, the character has vowed that it will never occur again.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Always Get Paid
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Always Get Paid[h4] A bounty hunter who doesn;t get paid doesn't eat, and starving while maintaining a terrifying reputation is still starving. This character's principles are primarily economic, and consist of tenets such as always working for the highest bidder, never taking on jobs out of sentiment, and accepting no payment besides cold, hard credits.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Quiet Professionalism
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Quiet Professionalism[h4] There is an old saying in the bounty hunting trade that good work makes little noise, and the character is the embodiment of that. Like a master artisan, the character pursues bounties with far greater care about attention to detail than most. The PC sees little need for flashy accoutrement or ostentatious shows of prowess.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Reputation is Everything
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Reputation is Everything[h4] To a bounty hunter, maintaining the appearance of being an unrelenting, unstoppable force is often as important as actually having the skills and strength of will to succeed in the chase. While false bravado usually falls apart in the face of the challenges a bounty hunter faces, many bounty hunters work hard to uphold their reputations, repaying slights and provocations with disproportionate violence.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Rule of Law
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Rule of Law[h4] There is nothing more important than the rule of law, and the character is sworn to protect it. As a bounty hunter, the character is an extension of galactic law, and works strictly to uphold it.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Only Score that Matters
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Only Score that Matters[h4] Only one thing matters to the character; having the highest body count. The PC only takes a bounty alive if it doesn't pay for the target dead, and is in constant competition with other like minded individuals to rack up the most kills.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Survival
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Survival[h4] A code is hardly relevant if the bounty hunter is too dead to uphold it, and while this character might have other principles or oaths, the first and foremost is to survive at all costs. While the character is still likely to take risks—no bounty hunter can avoid them, after all— this PC works to minimize them, and strives to be on the winning side in any engagement.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Economic
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Economic[h4] While many powerful corporations enjoy security and prosperity under the Empire's rule (and, often, patronage), other businesses suffer from lack of Imperial favor or from having had most or all of their assets nationalized and brought directly under the Empire's logistical control. The Player Character has business interests directly tied to the Alliance, and he's around to make sure his interests are looking after.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Empire
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Empire[h4] The Player Character used to be a part of the Empire. He was once a soldier, a spy, or even a high-ranking official, but something drove him not only to leave the oppressive regime, but to commit himself to its downfall.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Family
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Family[h4] The Player Character's family believes in the cause of the Alliance. Many of them may have signed on to serve in one way or another. Some (or all) of them could have died in that service. Regardless of his personal feelings, the PC fights for the Rebellion due to his family's involvement.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Mayhem
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Mayhem[h4] The character derives pleasure through destruction. He seldom passes up a chance to cause conflict and confusion in his work, even to the possible detriment of his own well-being. Extreme examples of this may even be forms of mental illness.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Life Debt
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Life Debt[h4] The character owes someone else, and owes them big. His life is in someone else's hands, and this debt requires him to fight. He may or may not enjoy this. but this motivation is so strong that it overrides his other desires.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Squadron
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Squadron[h4] An Ace can never truly know his brothers-in-arms until he serves with them in battle. While the character may be a bit cold and distant toward non-veterans, he is a true and loyal friend to anyone that has fought at his side.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Professional
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Professional[h4] Simply put, violence is this character's business, and that business is never in short supply. The character knows no other way to make his way in the galaxy. and thus treats his lethal work as any other job.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Best of the Best
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Best of the Best[h4] Be the best; that's the creed by which this character lives. In this case, he strives to be the best combatant. He wants to be the last one standing on the field of battle, the consummate warrior. He is willing to do whatever it takes to accomplish this.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Retirement
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Retirement[h4] The character has long since lost his lust for battle, and fights not because he loves the violence, but because he is very close to being able to safely retire. This could represent awaiting the end of an enlistment, accumulating credits to pay off a debt, repaying a favor, or awaiting an opportunity to clear his name before he gives up his life of violence.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Violent Conquest
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Violent Conquest[h4] The character is driven to conquer whatever and whomever he comes across. If they do not submit. he is more than willing to employ force against them.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Squadmates
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Squadmates[h4] One can never truly know his colleagues until he serves with them in battle. While the character may be a bit distant from non-veterans, he is a true and loyal friend to anyone with whom he has fought.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Blood Money
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Blood Money[h4] Simply put, violence is this character's business, and that business is never in short supply. The character knows no other way to make his way in the galaxy, and thus treats his bloody work as any other job.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Honor in Battle
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Honor in Battle[h4] The character holds true to a code of honor in warfare. This code could be an ancient tradition of one of the myriad civilizations in the galaxy or it could be his own personal beliefs. Whatever life case, his honor depends on following these tenets, even when it may be inconvenient.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Best in the Field
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Best in the Field[h4] Be the best: that's the creed by which this character lives. In this case, he strives to be the best combatant. He wants to be the last one standing on the field of battle, the consummate warrior. He is willing to do whatever it takes to accomplish this.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Revenge
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Revenge[h4] The character is driven by one of the oldest and most primal causes in the Galaxy—the desire to avenge some real or perceived wrong the character has suffered. The character's hunger for vengeance may be justified or not. but it is a cold, heartless master that can drive the character to obsession.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Out of the Game
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Out of the Game[h4] The character works as a mercenary not because he loves the violence, but because he needs to earn enough to buy his way out. This could be trying to accumulate enough money to retire, pay off his debts, or even perform some action to repay a friend before he gives up his life of violence.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Adrenaline Junky
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]TAdrenaline Junky[h4] Excitement, adventure; the character loves every bit of it. He doesn't fight for money, revenge, or a thirst for blood. He fights because he can't get enough of the incredible thrill of risking his life and coming out on top.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Friends
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Friends[h4] His friends left home and signed up. As soon as he was able, the Player Character did the same. He may or may not have been able to find any of them, or he may even have arrived right when they did. Regardless, he couldn't imagine staying at home once they left. Now he has to decide why he's really doing it.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Intelligence
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Intelligence[h4] The Player Character has one or more contacts within the Alliance Intelligence network, and he has somehow been ensnared to do increasingly more for the cause of the Rebellion. He may owe more than a few favors, or he may genuinely care about the people with whom he's been working.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Love Interest
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Love Interest[h4] The Player Character followed his heart right into the ranks of the Rebellion, either to be closer to the one he loves, or to find a way to help that person through rescue or protection. His connection may border on obsession if he's in too deep, yet he may also awaken to the greater threats he and his colleagues face.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Military
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Military[h4] When the war broke out, the PC's unit, which was serving a specific planet or other political entity, was transferred directly to the Alliance forces. His immediate command structure may have stayed relatively intact, but the upper echelons did not answer to Alliance High Command. The variety of locations land food) makes it interesting, at least.

SpecificMotivation.Name: No One
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]No One[h4] The Player Character is all alone in the galaxy. Whether he is just a loner or has lost everyone in a catastrophic Imperial attack, he has decided to join the Rebellion because he has nothing left to lose.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Political
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Political[h4] The Player Character represents a faction, planet, or sector that is part of the Alliance. He is directly involved as that groups ambassador or emissary, and the goals and motives of that group often supersede his own interests and desires.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Rescuer
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Rescuer[h4]

SpecificMotivation.Name: Rival
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Rival[h4]

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Underworld
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Underworld[h4] The Alliance depends heavily upon smugglers and illegal trade to get many of the resources it needs, and lately the Player Character has been aiding the Rebellion quite often. He may have already been involved in scrapes with the Empire, or that may be yet to come.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Society
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Society[h4] Many Colonists don't just seek a new life for themselves, they seek to help create an entirely new form of civilization. These characters are always looking for that moment when they can influence the way a government interacts with its citizens, be it at a town hall or parliamentary building. What kind of society they want to create varies from one being to the next.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Homestead
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Homestead[h4] Independence and self-sustainability are the quiet goals of those who seek to create their own homestead. These Colonists aren't interested in making a fortune. For the homesteader, it is enough to know that his success or failure is dependent on nothing but his own hard work. He desires to build his own home, and run it as he sees fit.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Legacy
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Legacy[h4] Most species in the galaxy are acutely aware of their own mortality. Some come to grips with this by creating a lasting legacy that lives on long after their passing. On a new world, where there are new challenges to rise up against and the planet's early history is in the process of being written, there is a much greater chance of creating or doing something that will live on. Characters with the Legacy motivation jump at any chance to do something that helps their name and deeds outlive them.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Family
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Family[h4] Many Colonists come to a new world as eligible single people, eager to learn a trade and attract a mate so they can settle down and have children. This is a humble motivation when compared to most but fitting for many characters who find it hard to care about events beyond their life on a simple backwater world.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Art
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Art[h4] Artists are inspired and influenced by their surroundings, and what inspiration could be better than a newly discovered planet? The open horizons, clear skies, and undiscovered species of flora and fauna can spark the creative impulse in anyone. Some of those on the frontier may seek to bring some art and culture into the new world. Others might seek to support the creation of art by acting as a patron.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Cure
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Cure[h4] Far from the cutting edge medicine of the Core, the fringe can seem an unhealthy place to live. But many seemingly worthless worlds may hold the key to wiping out deadly diseases. This might be the entire reason a character has chosen to be a Colonist to save a colony, a planet, or simply a friend or loved one from disease.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Understanding
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Understanding[h4] Many Colonists take an interest in their adopted world, seeking to gain a greater knowledge of their new home. Characters who seek to create a better understanding of the world have an insatiable curiosity about anything pertaining to the planet. This motivation can also refer to creating a peace between settlers, or between settlers and indigenousness.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Business
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Business[h4] Creating a new business to some untapped market is a dream shared by many Colonists. Most of those traveling to a new world hope only to open up a shop where they can ply their trade, but some think bigger. A badness started on a small colony may eventually grow to be an enterprise that rivals Kuat Drive Yards or Corellian Engineering Corporation.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Power Corrupts
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Power Corrupts[h4] The galaxy abounds with examples of how power corrupts, and few are more aware of this than the Player Character. With the Empire in control, the PC sees too much power being consolidated in too few hands, with inevitable results. Ultimately, the PC seeks to disrupt the Empire's authority and encourage systems that distribute power more fairly.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Living Memory
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Living Memory[h4] Convictions can become incredibly strong. Earlier in his life, the PC had no particular interest in fighting the Empire. Then someone close to him was lost as a result of the Empire's doing. Unable to simply let go, the PC carries on the cause in memory of his fallen comrade, because that is the only way to square his debt and bring about a future they could both be proud of.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Strive for Excellence
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Strive for Excellence[h4] Nobody is perfect, particularly the kind of scruff that joins the Rebel Alliance. However, the PC knows that the path to greatness requires continually striving to improve oneself. Those who live by this creed encourage everyone to live up to their ideals: to become stronger, faster, wiser, and more compassionate. By always aiming higher, the character builds a better team and a better self.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Body Needs a Head
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Body Needs a Head[h4] A group of individuals cannot act in unison for long with no one leading the way. The PC believes in the power of leadership and knows that he is the one for the job. The PC is willing to shoulder the burden of tough decisions, taking initiative to save others from stalling and indecisiveness. Nobody can be right all the time, but someone must step up to lead.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Order from Chaos
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Order from Chaos[h4] Strangeness and unpredictability abound, but nothing is beyond the reach of sentient minds working to bring order to the galaxy. The PC's personal mission is to bring sense and structure to everything, to see the patterns, and to collect the outliers in the chaotic systems of existence. Every seemingly random outcome is governed by rules, and the PC is just waiting to find them.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Never Alone
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Never Alone[h4] No one is ever alone. Through the vast webs of communication, trade, survival, and the Force, everything in the galaxy is connected to everything else. The PC knows that the best way to be happy is to bring happiness to others and deliver kindness to everyone. By spreading joy to others, the PC finds purpose and drive in life.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Return the Favor
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Return the Favor[h4] The PC is among those who believe that every good turn deserves another and every slight deserves retaliation in kind. When the Empire treats others badly, then the PC is only too happy to return the favor. The PC is helpful to his friends, and merciless to his enemies.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Be Unique
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Be Unique[h4] Even in a galaxy teeming with countless lives, every sentient mind is different. Therefore, going along with the majority sacrifices individuality. The PC values individuality and subversive difference, siding with the Rebellion because it rejects the crushing uniformity of the existing order.

SpecificMotivation.Name: People Are Counting on Me
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]People Are Counting on Me[h4] The PC works not only for personal gain, but also for the interests of a group of people threatened by the Empire. Therefore, the PC acts with those people in mind. Drawing power from thoughts of those in need, he can do what no one else can. He finds the strength to carry on, because giving up would fail so many others as well.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Balance Must Be Restored
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Balance Must Be Restored[h4] The PC believes that the fundamental nature of the galaxy is out of balance. Even those who are not Force-sensitive can see that the Empire is a nexus of evil. Therefore, a strong good must oppose it. The fight against the Empire is not just political or territorial. It is an ideological battle to cut the Empire down to size and restore the proper order.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Self
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Self[h4] The Explorer may be pursuing any number of goals or simply wandering the galaxy until something catches his interest. His main purpose, however, is to discover who he truly is and what he is meant to do with his life. Each new path offers him a chance to learn something new about himself, and each challenge he faces gives him insight into what he is really capable of. For many Explorers, this is a journey that will only end with their deaths...and possibly not even then.

SpecificMotivation.Name: "Anywhere But Here!"
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]"Anywhere But Here!"[h4] Instead of pursuing any one specific Discovery, the Explorer is driven by the thrill of exploration in and of itself. He is never content with the accomplishments of his previous expeditions, and as soon as he has finished one such trek, he is already planning the next. sometimes even before he has found his present quarry.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Civilization
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Civilization[h4] As vast as the galaxy is, there are untold cultures and societies that remain utterly unknown to the greater population. Many of these civilizations lived and died in total obscurity, while many others remain vital and ready to be encountered by someone dedicated and enterprising enough to search them out The Archaeologist career is especially suited for searching out and understanding the former, while the Trader will often find great joy in discovering the latter.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Planets
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Planets[h4] As vast as planets are, the Empire is exponentially larger. Stars can go for long stretches of time being listed on astrogation charts without anyone knowing what planets may orbit them and what those planets may have in the way of resources and utility as livable places. Finding a planet of worth can make an Explorers mark in the galaxy, as well as his fortune if he sells the information to the right buyer. Scouts, in particular, are specialists in such Discoveries.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Treasures
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Treasures[h4] Some hunt it for the glory. Some hunt it for the challenge. Most treasure hunters do so, however, for the opportunity to fill their accounts with more credits than they can imagine spending in one lifetime. Whether it's a cache of precious gems stashed away long ago by decades-dead pirates or the incalculable worth of art and crafts from an eons-dead civilization, treasure hunters know there are immense riches out there in the galaxy just waiting for them to find where X marks the spot.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Secrets
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Secrets[h4] For some, secrets are another kind of treasure, albeit one that provides access to power as well as wealth. Some seek out secrets at the behest of others, preferring to stay out of the direct conflicts caused by the possession of them, while others happily wield the secrets they've uncovered as weapons for their own pursuits. As powerful and wealth inducing as secrets can be, however, they can also be incredibly dangerous, many beings will kill to maintain important secrets, and many others will kill to obtain those who discover them in the first place.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Knowledge
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Knowledge[h4] Akin to secrets, but not always quite as dangerous, lost and hidden knowledge can be a powerful asset. Eons of conflict caused vast storehouses of knowledge to be lost amid the rubble of destroyed cities, derelict ships, and abandoned space stations. Intrepid Explorers are the miners of that knowledge, bringing it back into the light of day for all to benefit from. Archaeologists are naturally inclined to search for knowledge, as are Fringers and Traders.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Resources
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Resources[h4] Credits are credits, but resources drive the economies of every system, as well as the Empire itself. Raw materials power the Imperial war machine, which is ever expanding. So, too, does the burgeoning Rebellion crave important resources as it struggles to build up some semblance of an organized resistance. Of course, there are also the millions of businesses, factions, and entrepreneurs who seek one source or another of some special kind of resource in order to enhance their trade position and power. Those who can uncover such sources—Scouts are particularly sought after for such work—can make very good money.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Technology
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Technology[h4] Billions of scientists, engineers, and inventors throughout the galaxy have been creating wonders of technology for thousands of years. Much of it has been lost due to war or merely the fall of a civilization. Other scientific marvels manifest on a daily basis, unknown to the galaxy at large. Clever Explorers seek out these technological Discoveries to bring to the general population, though usually through either corporate or Imperial channels. Fringers and Traders are most likely to have such a focus, though Drivers will obviously be interested in any vehicular technology they can uncover.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Lost
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Lost[h4] Explorers know their way around the galaxy better than anyone. They know where the hidden places are, as well as the pathways and Interstellar routes that go unknown to all others. As such, Explorers are often called upon (either by others or by their own code) to seek out those who have become lost. Some seek to be lost, while many find they would no longer know the way home even if they wished to return. Many are unable to escape their current circumstances, needing to be found and liberated. Anyone with this specific Discovery result might wish to roll on the Relationship Motivation chart as well, determining who he is specifically seeking.

SpecificMotivation.Name: At All Costs
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]At All Costs[h4] No price is too high for this Commander when it comes to accomplishing his goals. War is a bloody affair in which lives are lost and sacrifices are made. He’s prepared to die in order to complete his objectives, and he expects his troops to lay down their own lives if necessary.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Command
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Command[h4] The power or prestige of command drives this Commander. He strives to do his best in the line of duty so he can earn rank and renown. His ambitions drive every action he takes and fuel every order he gives. He’s willing to do just about anything to prove himself and achieve the authority he knows he deserves.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Ego
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Ego[h4] This Commander feels he is the best at everything he does, and his ego drives him to maintain a nearly impossible status quo. Considering his plans to be flawless, he has a tendency to blame his own failures on his subordinates.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Game
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Game[h4] War is a game, and this Commander sees every participant—including himself—as a playing piece on a board. He has a tendency to analyze battles tactically, dissecting them and learning from his mistakes. Every deed done is a series of moves or countermoves, every enemy officer is an opponent, and winning the game is the only acceptable outcome.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Guilt
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Guilt[h4] The Commander is motivated to keep his troops alive due to the guilt he inevitably feels when they die under his command. He spends many waking hours analyzing his orders, as well as the events surrounding them, in an attempt to assuage his anguish for the lives he feels he's lost.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Mission
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Mission[h4] The current assignment or mission drives this Commander. He stops at nothing to see that the orders he's been given are carried out, and carried out well He doesn't give up easily, and he is considered to be a tenacious warrior by the troops who serve under him.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Redemption
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Redemption[h4] This Commander has done something terrible in the line of duty and feels that he must somehow redeem himself. Whatever it is he thinks he’s done—sending troops to their deaths, giving an order that resulted in civilian casualties, or failing to accomplish an objective—influences every order he gives and every decision he makes.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Retirement
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Retirement[h4] Leading troops in war is a horrible business, and this Commander wants nothing more than to retire and put it all behind him. Unfortunately, the conflict against the Empire is far from over. He must carry on and do his duty before he can reap the benefits of victory and live in peace.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Spirit
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Spirit[h4] This Commander believes he is the tool of a higher power, be it a deity, the Force, or a lofty ideal such as the Republic. He makes his decisions based on his faith, and in times of great peril he takes comfort in it. He may seem strange to his subordinates, especially those who don’t share in his beliefs, but his guiding principles and moral character are obvious to anyone who takes the time to look.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Subordinates
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Subordinates[h4] The people who serve under this Commander are his sole motivation. He always keeps their best interests in mind, fosters their talents, and tries to ensure they have an opportunity to grow as soldiers. He's also a stickler for accountability; when his troops don’t perform to his expectations, he’s certain to let them know.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Cosmic Force
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Cosmic Force[h4] The character understands on some level that everything that happens, has happened, or will happen in the galaxy is part of the Cosmic Force. The Force guides the galaxy and the individuals within it, and things happen for a reason.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Friends and Family
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Friends and Family[h4] The character believes in, and trusts, his close friends and family. He knows that unlike lofty ideals or strange religions, those close to him will always support him, and he supports them in turn.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Goodness of People
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Goodness of People[h4] The character believes in the inherent goodness of most people. He believes that together, the majority of different beings in the galaxy can interact to create an all encompassing civilization that is greater than the sum of its parts.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Imperial Rule
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Imperial Rule[h4] Though the Empire has done some terrible things, the order it brings to galactic society is still better than the moribund Republic that came before The character believes that the Galactic Empire is the best thing for the galaxy.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Jedi Code
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Jedi Code[h4] Though the Empire strives to suppress knowledge of the Jedi, the character knows the code of this ancient order. He follows it, feeling that It is something worth his belief and devotion.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Natural World
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Natural World[h4] The character believes in the spirits of the living things around him. Whether he recognizes this as the Living Force or has a more shamanistic approach to his beliefs, he respects the spirits of nature and even prays to them.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Nothing
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Nothing[h4] The character refuses to put his faith in something greater. The galaxy is a chaotic and random place, and the only thing that someone can trust in is himself.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Rebellion
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Rebellion[h4] The sooner the Galactic Empire is defeated, the better, The character believes absolutely that the Rebel Alliance is in the right and is doing what must be done to free the galaxy from tyranny.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Religious Code
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Religious Code[h4] There are countless religions in the galaxy, and the character adheres to one of his choice. Perhaps this is the religion of his family or his people. Perhaps he is a more recent convert. In any case, he adheres to It faithfully.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Science and Reason
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Science and Reason[h4] The character believes in reason, knowledge, and scientific understanding. Everything, even the Force, has a logical explanation and works according to certain rules, even If he doesn't understand what those rules are.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Force Connection
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Force Connection[h4] For many Consulars, the Force is like water, flowing between the life that creates it and the Consular, connecting them. For most, this flow of energy is a mere trickle, but with effort and time, it can flow like a powerful river. PCs with the Force Connection Growth Motivation seek new means to expand their connection to the Force, certain that as their connection grows, the means to bring peace to the galaxy becomes clearer.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Apprentice
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Apprentice[h4] Some Consulars are focused less on their own growth and more on the personal growth of others. These Consulars see great potential in a student and hope to guide that student on a path in keeping with their own ideals.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Friendship
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Friendship[h4] Trust in the Force, and it often provides its servants with all they might need. The solution to any puzzle is often a matter of obtaining the right perspective or finding the right person for the job. Consulars looking to grow their circle of friends know that being kind and generous to others is its own reward and often brings kindness and generosity back tenfold. Though Jedi were warned against attachment, most had many friends from their travels.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Hope
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Hope[h4] It is a dark time for the galaxy, when the Empire crushes resistance and those who are different without care. In this era of oppression, many Consulars know that the best they can offer the downtrodden is the hope that one day things can get better. These PCs have visions of hope spreading across the galaxy, and seek to inspire even the lowliest beggar or prisoner to hope again.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Jedi Order
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Jedi Order[h4] Many Consulars believe the only way to restore peace and harmony to the galaxy is to rebuild the Jedi Order. This means not only locating and training other Force sensitives, but also convincing those in hiding to do the same. It can also mean helping those fallen to the dark side become Jedi once again. Consulars with this Motivation may wish to spread the ideals of the Jedi Order, even to those who cannot touch the Force.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Life
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Life[h4] Life itself creates the Force, and places teeming with life tend to be strong in the Force. PCs with this Motivation hope to see life flourish everywhere and do their part to help life along. This might mean using their unique skills to stop war, plague, or famine. This Motivation can also express itself in smaller ways, such as cultivating a garden or planting seeds of nearly extinct species wherever the Consular goes.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Allies
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Allies[h4] Consulars know that achieving a lasting peace can only happen when lines of communication between various factions are open to diplomacy. Growing and strengthening friendly, diplomatic connections between groups is a way to ensure they keep talking to each other and only engage in violence as a last resort. This might mean bringing a small community closer together, overseeing diplomatic negotiations between warring planets, or bringing new resistance movements into the Rebel Alliance fold.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Community
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Community[h4] While many Consulars take a macro view of the galaxy, just as many find that perspective far too detached from the beings who inhabit it. Consulars focused on community think small, believing that peace is a natural result when community members grow together and engage in the lives of their neighbors.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Knowledge
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Knowledge[h4] The galaxy is in a state of turmoil and tyranny thanks to the Galactic Empire, which exercises absolute control over the flow of information. Many Consulars realize that breaking the restriction of information and sharing that knowledge with those around them are the only ways to check the darker forces in the galaxy.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Wisdom/Experience
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Wisdom/Experience[h4] Most Consulars aspire to be wise leaders or advisors, enabling those in their orbit to lead happier, fuller lives. Unlike knowledge, wisdom comes only from doing, by experiencing life in all its challenges. Those seeking wisdom often search for those who have it and, more importantly, have a zeal for experiencing, seeing, and trying new things to broaden their perspective.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Accuracy
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Accuracy[h4] Precision is important, in everything from sensors to weapons. These Engineers can become passionate over increasing exactness in all things, and might hate the Empire all the more for the way it twists truths and rewrites history.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Efficiency
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Efficiency[h4] Fuel and materiel are always being wasted, and these Engineers are driven to eliminate such losses at every opportunity. The Empire wastes lives and productivity, adding yet another reason for its elimination.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Challenge
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Challenge[h4] It would be easier to leave things as they are, but these Engineers view difficulty as part of the reward and a sign of their prowess. Similarly, the struggle against the Empire is perhaps the most important challenge they face.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Lethality
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Lethality[h4] It is clear to these Engineers that the more deadly the weapon, the better it is. They may also strive to make themselves as dangerous as possible through martial training and physical conditioning.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Aesthetics
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Aesthetics[h4] These Engineers search for ways to make their creations as pleasing to look at as they are effective; some apply this personality to improve their social interactions and thus garner more support for their efforts.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Reliability
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Reliability[h4] Weapons and ships that won't work cannot serve the Rebellion, so Engineers cannot allow them to become or remain unreliable. Increasing dependability not only aids in the war, but increases morale and fighting effectiveness.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Flexibility
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Flexibility[h4] Good Engineers work toward making sure everything - from tools to tanks - can be used in a variety of ways. These Engineers might also seek to improve themselves so that they are able to perform a wide variety of tasks.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Durability
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Durability[h4] Replacement items are always an issue, so everything in the Rebellion must last as long as possible. Engineers are always working to ensure weapons and vehicles function longer and to craft defenses to ensure they survive to fight another day.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Makeshift
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Makeshift[h4] Anyone can improve things given sufficient resources, but true artisans can take whatever might be around and craft mechanical art. While Rebels are often starved for parts, these Engineers might deliberately use improvised items to create personal works.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Simplicity
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Simplicity[h4] The best items are the ones that perform their functions in a basic manner, and Engineers work to eliminate anything that stands in the way of this goal. Lives are also lived best this way, but the Empire's harsh oversight of all aspects of its citizenry is in direct opposition to the ideal.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Disenfranchisement
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Disenfranchisement[h4] Beyond just the loss of voting rights, this can also mean the loss of other essential rights. Sentinels fighting this Injustice seek to reinstate such losses through diplomatic, legal or even illicit and violent means.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Violence
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Violence[h4] Warfare is but one type of violent Injustice. Gang warfare, armed conflicts between authorities and criminal elements or resistance groups, or terrorist attacks can turn a vibrant community into a place of despair and horror.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Displacement
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Displacement[h4] Without a home or a homeworld, a species not only loses resources but also the loss of identity. Even those who have an economic buffer might find themselves in a bureaucratic limbo with no legal status.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Hunger
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Hunger[h4] Considered the most basic Injustice, the denial of food has made civilizations collapse. Sentinels often find a wide range of complex obstacles in solving this problem—apathy, poverty, logistics, and institutional stubbornness.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Illness
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Illness[h4] Illness can devastate communities and finding a cure requires uncovering and understanding the root causes. Sentinels split their time healing the sick, investigating causes and preventing others from simply removing the victims.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Imprisonment
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Imprisonment[h4] A just society isolates a troubled individual for rehabilitation and community protection, while an unjust one imprisons based on prejudice or a list for power. Sentinels bettling unjust imprisonment often find themselves fighting against corrupt police forces and legal system personnel, especially with a planet aligned with the Empire.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Oppression
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Oppression[h4] Similar to Disenfranchisement, this Injustice sees one group using culture, law or violence to abuse others, usually a minority. Sentinels spend as much time fighting the oppressors as they do protecting the oppressed.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Poverty
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Poverty[h4] Money makes modern civilization work. A lack of money results in not only an inability to participate in modern society but also a dearth in access to resources that help a person earn an income in the first place. Money may not buy happiness, but the lack of money guarantees misery and can lead to crime.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Prejudice
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Prejudice[h4] Sentinels fighting prejudice often operate as street-level diplomats, confronting individuals about their acts and stopping violence as it occurs. Prejudice is usually personal and ingrained. Sentinels might find themselves arguing with bigots completely unaware or in denial of their bigotry.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Slavery
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Slavery[h4] The responsibility for slavery rests not only on the shoulders of the slavers, but on the societies and industries that benefit from their labor. This Motivation can also include manumission and droid rights.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Fabrication
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Modification[h4] The character likes building useful things. Some creations could be helpful to society, but many are projects of purely personal nature. The character introduces novel twists to known designs, but does not like to spend time inventing wholly new concepts just for the sake of it. The character might occasionally try to invent a new technology if nothing can solve a particular problem, but generally follows the principle that the best creations come about from study and refinement rather than attempts to make totally unprecedented things.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Personal Improvement
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Personal Improvement[h4] The character does anything and everything to acquire enhanced abilities, whether to make up for a devastating injury or merely to exceed the limitations of nature. This character likely already has cybernetics and will be seeking to expand their effectiveness. Other character might regard the character as dangerously willing to give new cybernetic program or device a try, no matter its source even if the potential downside could alter the character's life for the worse.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Invention
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Invention[h4] The character constantly desires to create new devices, vehicles or programs. Sometimes, the character invents something new to overcome a specific problem, but more often than not, the act of inventing something new is its own reward. Of course, the character's desire for novelty can sometimes get in the way of finding an expedient solution. After all, sometimes a simple tool is the best one for a given job. Still a character driven by this Motivation is likely to at least try reinventing the wheel from time to time, even if the results aren't particularly useful.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Modification
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Modification[h4] The character loves to extend the usefulness of a device or program by boosting its abilities or giving it new functions. A character with this Motivation often adds new parts or code to the original item, ceaselessly fiddling with it even after its function is what most would consider optimal. Some individuals turn modifications into an art form - whether literally artistic or metaphorically so - through clever use of technology.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Technical Business Interests
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Technical Business Interests[h4] The character strives to own and operate a successful legal or outlaw business in a particular area of expertise. The business might consume all of the character's time when not out adventuring with the other PCs. It might run itself in the character's absence by way of employees or automation or it might go on hiatus whenever the character has to go gallivanting across the galaxy. However, it is always on the character's mind, and the character is likely looking for ways to expand or improve it even when away.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Technological Fascination
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Technological Fascination[h4] The character loves to work with a specific type of machine, sometimes to the point of excluding all others, be it firearms, starhips, droids, or some other more esoteric branch of technology. The character seeks out new information and the latest news pertaining to this area of fascination and knows the intricacies of various models and minute differences between them. The character might have favourite models, but this singular obsession is not usually limited to one specific object or design.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Technological Historian
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Technological Historian[h4] The character is very interested in historic or ancient technology and strives to learn more about it, meticulously cataloguing any findings for future publication. The character might amass an extensive collection that others regard as useless junk, going out of the way to acquire seemingly meaningless and often expensive archaic devices. Occasionally, the character finds a useful or amazing item that might bring a high price from a collector or other interested party, or draw unwanted attention from treasure seekers and the authorities.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Technological Necessity
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Technological Necessity[h4] The character has a great need to complete or acquire a specific device or program. The goal might be to save a world, a town or a life or to provide a workable solution to an important diplomatic or military situation. Whatever the specifics of this need, the character likely sees its completion as a magnum opus and stakes a considerable amount of hope upon the promise of salvation the unfinished business represents.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Technical Rival
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Technical Rival[h4] The character cultivates a rivalry with another Technician who works in the same field of technology. The character tries to one-up the rival whenever possible, and is driven to get up each morning by a desire to surpass this rival as a creator. The rival might be just as invested in the rivalry as the character, or perhaps the rival is completely unaware of the PC's efforts. The rival can be an NPC or even another PC in the party.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Waste Not, Want Not
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Waste Not, Want Not[h4] The character hates to let anything go to waste and tries to devise ways of recycling or refurbishing discarded parts, scrap metal, old technology and worn-out droids. Perhaps the character comes from a remote world where technology and materials are scarce and anything remotely technological is expensive. Perhaps the character simply hates the thought of later realizing that something thrown away was useful. While this character's workshop and living area are often cluttered, the character likely claims to know where everything is.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Enamored of the Kindalo
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Enamored of the Kindalo[h4] This character is fascinated by the legends of the underground Kindalo culture, and wants to learn everything about it. This may cause problems among the locals when the character starts to disturb forbidden holy sites.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Follower of Orphne
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Follower of Orphne[h4] The character encountered the mystic Orphne and had a life-changing experience. The PC will talk about it to anyone who will listen, and continues to seek out mystic experiences that will further change her life.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Isolationist
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Isolationist[h4] This character wants to ensure that the wider galaxy continues to fail to notice Auratera, and goes to great lengths to ensure its secrecy.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Study of the Past
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Study of the Past[h4] The collection of different archaeological constructions at the Auratera vergence fascinates the character, inspiring the PC to become something of an amateur archaeologist.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Frangawl Sympathizer
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Frangawl Sympathizer[h4] This character believes the old ways are the best. The PC harbors secret beliefs in the Frangawl traditions, and although not a Frangawl cultist, would turn a blind eye if the cult were to attempt to stage another return.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Mendicant
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Mendicant[h4] This character has taken a vow of poverty and wanders the galaxy, hoping to build a deeper connection with the Force by renouncing unimportant things. The PC may rely on the good will of others, but will repay the favor in any way possible.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Preservationist
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Preservationist[h4] The character believes Bardottan history to be extremely important—and potentially at risk. The PC will do anything to preserve historical sites and artifacts, and will personally hunt down those who sell such things offworld.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Matriarch
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Matriarch[h4] This character is a staunch supporter of Devaron’s matriarchal society. Whether female or male, the character believes that male beings should defer to females in important matters, and will only grudgingly accept male leaders under great duress.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Collaborator
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Collaborator[h4] This native of Iktotch actively worked with Imperial agents to assist with the moon’s occupation. Whether regretting these actions or not, the character is reviled by the Iktotchi and will always be an outsider to them.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Exile
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Exile[h4] This character was part of the Iktotchi exodus before the Empire seized control of the galaxy and blockaded Iktotchon. The character longs for the day when it becomes possible to return home—when the Empire is no longer a threat to the beloved moon.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Visions of the Future
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Visions of the Future[h4] This character believes—correctly or incorrectly—that she has a sense of precognition that allows him to anticipate the future. She insists on providing this information to her companions and becomes greatly distressed when it is not acted upon.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Revolutionary
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Revolutionary[h4] Sickened by the Empire’s oppression, this character wants nothing more than to join a revolution to remove the Imperial presence from Lothal once and for all. The PC may want to concentrate efforts on local sabotage or to journey into the galaxy to join a larger cause.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Up from Poverty
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Up from Poverty[h4] This character has spent her entire life living in Lothal’s squalor, and wants nothing more than to drag himself out of it. Credits, riches, her own ship—any status symbol at all to help him forget lean nights of eating old leather and grass.

SpecificMotivation.Name: War Profiteer
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]War Profiteer[h4] For a few Lothalians, the Imperial occupation has been incredibly lucrative. This character has colluded with the Empire in some way, to great personal gain, and will do anything to protect this wealth.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Envoy
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Envoy[h4] The character seeks to mend the differences between the Naboo and Gungan peoples. The PC may attempt this through political means, or by engineering an event that might lead to unification.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Gungan Rights
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Gungan Rights[h4] The character believes the Gungans are an oppressed minority on Naboo and seeks to establish them either as equals or as superior to the Naboo. The PC may be outspoken in this belief to the point of obnoxiousness, or may harbor it deep inside, fearing to express it.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Poet
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Poet[h4] The character wants to experience the beauty and majesty of galactic life, then return home and express the experiences in word or in song. The PC may recklessly pursue beauty and experiences where others would be more cautious.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Archaeologist
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Archaeologist[h4] The character is aware of the ancient history of Ossus, and actively engages in scholarship and fieldwork to uncover more of the planet’s secrets.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Plunderer
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Plunderer[h4] The past means nothing to this character, apart from an easy way to make some quick credits. Artifacts, old texts, even the location of a hidden antiquity site—all of these things are merely means to the end of increasing wealth.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Caste Member
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Caste Member[h4] This character knows her place within the social hierarchy, and doesn’t easily tolerate beings who do not. She is quick to point out beings she believes have jumped above their station—or those who are acting beneath their station.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Force-Reverent
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Force-Reverent[h4] This character views any Force user as a powerful wizard, capable of wreaking great destruction or being an immense help. The PC displays a level of respect bordering on obsequiousness to any Force user. A Force-using character with this Motivation sees the Force as indistinguishable from magic; upon encountering other Force users, the PC may attempt to teach them rituals, spells, and chants so they can “harness” their power.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Wide-Eyed Wanderer
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Wide-Eyed Wanderer[h4] This character has lived a sheltered existence and views the galaxy at large as a scary and nearly magical place. Blasters are confounding, droids may be devils in disguise, and travel between the stars is akin to dark sorcery. Flowever, all this only serves to interest the character more, inducing a hunger to travel in this strange and wondrous galaxy.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Death
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Death[h4] What happens to beings when they die? Is death a necessary part of existence, or is something to be fought against at every opportunity? Can someone cheat death and, if so, what is the cost? These are the questions that drive the character.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Life
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Life[h4] Is life simply a biological and chemical creation? Or is it something more? Force users have an understanding that the Force is linked to life, and life to the Force. However, what it means to be a living being is still largely not understood. They also grapple with the question of life itself: should sentient beings be protected? Or does life serve no meaning beyond its own instincts and needs? Sometimes, life itself must be assumed as a burden or gift alike.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Force
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Force[h4] What is the Force? How and why does it exist, and does it have a will of its own? Does the Force determine one’s actions, or obey one’s commands? Or is it both, and if that is true, how is that possible? Many ancient Jedi meditated on the mysteries of the Force, though to solve them all is likely impossible.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Destiny and Fate
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Destiny and Fate[h4] The character wants to know if destiny truly exists. Do all beings have a fate set down for them at the moment of their creation? Can one thwart their fate, or is it an exercise in futility? And if one fulfills their destiny, what then? Above all, the character wants to know what their own destiny is, and must decide whether to fulfill or avoid it.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Happiness
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Happiness[h4] What is happiness? What does it mean to be satisfied and happy with one’s life, and is it fair to obtain happiness while it is denied to others? The character strives to understand the true nature of happiness, and hopes that by unlocking this mystery, they may find happiness for themselves as well.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Balance
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Balance[h4] Does the universe require balance? For every good thing in the galaxy, must there be a bad thing as well? Can the light ever win out over the darkness, or must they always be locked in eternal struggle? The character strives to discover these mysteries, and may see themself as duty-bound to bring balance to the galaxy, for good or for ill.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Suffering
